title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.
   

  

 A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
   

  

 Senior Sales Engineer
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Field sales engineering position selling Equinix solutions to new accounts and/or expanding existing accounts
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Technical Consulting and Sales Support
   

  

* Identifies customer’s business needs, challenges, and technical requirements and maps to Equinix solutions
* Understands and explains customer applications and business challenges
* Utilizes understanding of Equinix portfolio of products to deliver pitch on Equinix solutions
* Analyses situations and data on problems of moderate scope
* Provides full support for medium to large customers, including global deployments


 Solution Design and Deliverables
   

  

* Provides technical solution design expertise to all assigned Sales account executives
* Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to figure out appropriate solution
* Assists in RFI/P/Q preparation as requested by Sales Representatives
* Independently delivers all work for the customer


 Customer Service
   

  

* Communicates with customers (internal and external) in a professional, friendly and effective manner, both verbally and in writing
* Assists in pre-sales efforts for all company products
* Provides technical support in sales presentations, customer meetings, and trade shows


 Business and Market Expertise
   

  

* Demonstrates a solid understanding of Equinix datacenter, Network, and Cloud products and services
* Possesses industry knowledge and familiarity with the competitive landscape


 Collaboration / Communication
   

  

* Develops new business opportunities and grows existing customer relationships
* Motivates internal teams (CSM, OM, IM, Ops, etc.) to ensure smooth project transition from pre-sales to post-sales
* Influences the cultivation of a positive culture on the team
* Demonstrates good presentation skills


 Team Leadership
   

  

* Supports initiatives and team projects to better the organization


**Qualifications**
 Essential
   

  

* Degree in Engineering / IT or equivalent experience
* Extensive Customer facing experience within internet, cloud or telecommunications services industry
* In-depth knowledge of Networks and/or Cloud Computing
* Ability to work independently with minimal management guidance
* Problem resolution
* Ability to understand and explain related technical issues, thorough knowledge of products, potential applications and associated technologies
* Outstanding interpersonal skills – ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers
* Creation of high quality business proposals in line with agreed customer needs and expectations
* Ability to project manage, multitask and follow through
* Ability to work and adapt in rapidly changing environment
* Excellent English written and oral communications skills
* Negotiation skills


 Desired
   

  

* Understanding of Business Procedures i.e Finance, Marketing, Forecasting, Business Plans and Contracts
* Relationship building skills
* Provision of accurate forecasts and reports
* Process orientation, analytical and deductive reasoning skills
* Experience with customer support systems
* Strong knowledge and experience with telecom circuit ordering and provisioning
* In depth understanding of datacentre architecture
* UPS, Generator, Cooling, Fire detection and suppression
* In-depth knowledge of UK cabling standards and implementation


 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Payroll Associate
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Payroll team
 





 The Payroll team is responsible for payroll processes, calculation of wages and ensuring that employees’ salaries are paid correctly and on schedule. The main tasks for a Payroll Associate are to support the organisation in payroll related matters, drive internal projects and process the monthly payroll for large companies within the Trustly group. The Payroll Associate contributes with payroll knowledge to the team.
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* Payroll Service Delivery
* Ensure timely and correct payroll service to all Trustly entities
* Process end to end Payroll processes including all administration, activities and controls required in  pre-payroll, payroll-run and post-payroll
* Take an active part in finding an efficient and clear split of work load within the payroll team
* Ensure timely and correct post Payroll reporting to external and internal stakeholders and authorities
* Manage pension, insurance and benefit administration
* Responsible for developing and maintaining the functions in Payroll software proposing changes to third party software provider
* Responsible for educating employees and managers in the time reporting system
* Responsible for support management, including queries from employees, managers and authorities
* Contribute with Payroll knowledge to more complex queries from the organization
* Involvement in projects within the Payroll function
* Ensure employees are paid accurately according to local legislation
* Maintain employee confidence and protect Payroll operations by keeping information confidential
* Stakeholder management and working cross functionally with HR, Accounting, external payroll providers etc



  




**Who you are** 
* High School degree or above
* Education and preferably certification within Payroll
* Previous experience in payroll admin and processing
* Knowledge in Swedish law and regulation impacting Payroll
* Previous experience in Payroll in EMEA is meritorious but not a requirement
* Communication skills, ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels
* Structured work approach, ability to manage complex process flows and deliver administrative services with high quality
* Being structured, taking ownership, and staying curious are key attributes to make this role a success
* Fluent in English






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.**

title: Merchant Credit Analyst - Stockholm
description:
**Be a part of the next big thing**
 Do you thrive on tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about creating impactful solutions that drive commerce forward? Do you believe in encouraging and elevating those around you?
   

  

**About Us**
 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, we support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. We offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where businesses operate, we deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers—driving growth globally. 🌍
   

  

**The role**
 As a Merchant Credit Analyst at Kustom, you'll play a crucial role in safeguarding our merchant portfolio by conducting thorough financial analysis of our largest merchants. You'll be part of our growing risk team, helping to build and maintain robust monitoring processes as we transition our risk operations in-house.
   

  

**Things you'll be doing**
* Analyze financial statements and assess merchant financial health
* Monitor and evaluate financial trends and business sustainability of major merchants
* Manage regular financial statement collection and review processes
* Develop and implement risk assessment frameworks
* Collaborate with commercial teams while maintaining strong risk principles
* Help develop the next-generation counter-party risk monitoring framework


**Skills And Experience You'll Need**
* Strong financial analysis skills with experience in reading and interpreting financial statements
* Background in credit risk assessment, preferably from another payment service provider, fintech, or bank
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Strong communication skills to effectively convey risk decisions
* Experience with risk monitoring systems and tools


**We believe you'll thrive in this role if you have**
* High degree of integrity and the confidence to make tough decisions
* Strong sense of accountability and independence
* Initiative-taking mindset and proactive approach to problem-solving
* Ability to maintain professional judgment under pressure
* Collaborative spirit while being able to stand firm on risk decisions


**Benefits**
* Robust pension plan with national and occupational components
* Excellent health insurance coverage, including long-term illness protection and salary exchange options
* Annual wellness allowance of 3,000 SEK to invest in your health and fitness
* Extra day off when major holidays (e.g., Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve) fall on weekends
* Continuous learning opportunities and professional development support


**A place to grow**
 At Kustom, you won’t just be another face in the crowd. This is a place where we elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. We believe in our ability to create excellence — and have fun doing it!
   

  

 We know we set high expectations, but we also know that the road to success isn’t a straight line. We support and encourage each other to try, to fail, to try again. Because that’s how we grow, individually and together.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you?
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please apply in English. At Kustom, we welcome everyone! We don’t care where you’re from, whom you love, or what kind of food is your favorite (unless we’re celebrating together, then we’ll need to know 😉!). We believe in inclusivity for all.
* Given the above, we treat all candidates the same! That’s why we have this awesome recruitment tool to keep track of all the amazing talents that apply - so please; apply through the system and we’ll make sure to keep you updated along the recruitment process. Please note that we can’t keep track of CVs or similar documents sent via email.
* We value your privacy! When you apply, we'll handle your data with care. Want to know more about how we use your information? Check out our FAQs at the bottom of the jobs page - we've got all the details there for you!

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**Description - Sales Development Representative** 




  





 Listed in Tempo's Top 100 Start Up's and featured on The Sunday Times's Top Ten Small Companies to work for, with over a decade's experience recruiting and training the best-in-class SDRs EngageTech offers three solutions; outsourced SDRs, a sales intelligence platform & Managed SDRs. Through the utilization of our outsourced SDR service and our sales intelligence platform businesses can generate qualified leads fast.
 



 Now is the perfect time to come on board, with us expanding into different markets, developing pioneering new service lines, and most excitingly setting up new offices in even more international locations.
 



 We hire on passion and personality, so previous experience isn't paramount, and with our world-class three-month development Sales training program we think almost anyone can be a successful SDR if they wish!
 



  





 We are looking for individuals to join the outsourced SDR solution.
 



  





**What you'll be doing:** 



* Booking outbound meetings through cold calling
* Also generating outbound meetings through a multi-channel approach of emails, social selling, networking, and independent research
* Establishing genuine relationships with key stakeholders across the business and externally with our different clients
* Engaging with a range of prospects, including C-suite/Directors, from all sorts of different organizations ranging from Blue Chip to the Public Sector
* Lead discovery conversations with prospects on behalf of our clients to unearth challenges and an understanding of digital roadmaps for the coming year



  





**More about this role:** 



* Striving to learn on a day-to-day basis, as well as providing mentorship to those in your team and around you
* Delivering World Class Customer Service for clients at every touchpoint of the process, adhering to best practice
* Work in tandem with clients to manage sales pipeline; maintain impeccable administration and update all activity in our CRM
* Continually act as an ambassador for the EngageTech brand
* Add value to other areas of the business! You have the opportunity to bring your interests and passions outside of your professional life to the role - whether it be sport, Diversity & Inclusion, or Corporate Social Responsibility
* Influence the growth of the overall business



  





**Requirements** 



* Articulate, with strong written & verbal communication skills and a talent for building rapport and accelerating relationships
* Swedish & Dutch speaking is desirable
* A desire to work with lots of different stakeholders, be they clients, colleagues, managers, or prospects
* An interest or affinity with the Tech industry
* Simple, but a can-do, positive mindset
* Have the flexibility to thrive in a scale-up, high-growth environment where things are constantly evolving
* Accountable for your actions and input on a day-to-day basis
* Appreciative of the value of solid relationships with your colleagues
* Relish the opportunity to have continuous learning and development



  





**Benefits** 



* Investment into personal development, with a clear personalized plan to achieve your goals
* Uncapped Commission
* Hybrid-working with a sociable office and the opportunity to work from home
* A three-month SDR training program to unlock your potential
* Mental Health support, with chat therapy courses available
* A Mental and Well-being Day to spend on activities that make you happy
* Opportunities to; travel, work and learn in one of our international locations, including; Stockholm, Edinburgh and Cape Town
* Working equipment provided, including new laptops
* Quarterly incentives such as ‘Diamond Club' Michelin meals
* Company incentive trips away to places including Ibiza, Milan & Tenerife
* Women in Tech and Diversity & Inclusion Initiatives
* Sabbatical opportunity after one year
* Breakfast & snacks in the office
* 25 Days Annual Leave

title: Systemspecialist OT & Automation
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**En spännande vardag – för en fossilfri framtid.** 
 Hos oss får du vara med och påverka morgondagens klimatsmarta samhälle och skapa framtidens elnät.
   

  

 Automationsområdet växer snabbt och Vattenfall Eldistribution installerar allt mer automation i elnätet. Förutom reinvesteringsbehov av föråldrad utrustning finns det starka drivkrafter genom ökade krav på färre och kortare elavbrott och möjliggörare för ytterligare digitalisering. Gruppen OT & Automation ansvarar för drift och förvaltning av automationsutrustning, såsom RTU:er, HMI:er och switchar, i hela dess livscykel och jobbar aktivt som teknisk kravställare i anläggningsinvesteringsprojekten.
   

  

 Som Systemspecialist i gruppen OT & Automation kommer du att jobba i gränslandet mellan IT och elkraft/kontrollanläggning. Du kommer att samverka med våra investeringsprojekt för att styra utformningen av kommunikations- och fjärrkontrollösningar vid nybyggnation av transformatorstationer i Sverige. Du kommer även att delta i arbetet med förvaltning av automationsutrustning i vårt elnät.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Delta och representera gruppen i investeringsprojekt vid nybyggnation av transformatorstationer, genom att agera kravställare för kommunikations- och fjärrkontrollösning.
* Förvaltningsarbete och livscykelhantering för automationsutrustning.
* Test- och utvecklingsarbete av automationsfunktioner och tekniska lösningar.
* Kravställning och granskning av tekniska lösningar vid upphandlingar mot materialleverantörer.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsavdelningar såväl internt som externt för att utveckla nya tekniska lösningar.
* Vidareutveckla vår förvaltningsprocess och samverka med andra avdelningar.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna på högskoleingenjörsnivå med inriktning mot automation, el/tele, datakommunikation och nätverk, IT/OT. T ex Elektroingenjör, Automationsingenjör, Datateknik eller motsvarande kunskap genom tidigare erfarenhet.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat både i tal och skrift.
* Har B-körkort.


**Det är meriterande om du:**
* Har kunskap och erfarenhet från arbete med fjärrkontrollterminaler (RTU:er), HMI:er, PLC- programmering, switchar, routrar, nätverk och tillhörande förvaltning.
* Grundläggande kunskaper i ellära, elkraftssystem, processautomation, IEC 61850, IP-baserade kommunikationslösningar eller projektledning.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och välkomnar både nyutexaminerade studenter och mer seniora kandidater. Som person tror vi att du är du har stor nyfikenhet för tekniska lösningar inom elnät och automation, är serviceinriktad och att du trivs med att ha en sammanhållande roll för olika teknikfrågor inom området. Då kontaktnätet i rollen är brett, både internt och externt, krävs en god samarbetsförmåga och förmågan att arbeta strukturerat. Vidare tror vi att du är prestigelös och ansvarstagande i ditt egna arbete.
   

  

 Ett krav är att du bör ha god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Trollhättan, Solna, Västerås, Linköping eller Uppsala. Resor i tjänsten förekommer, främst baserade runt placeringsort.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle så erbjuder vi en arbetsplats med goda möjligheter till utveckling. Vi uppmuntrar dig som vill komma vidare och utforska nya områden inom företaget. Med vår karriär- och utvecklingsmodell vill vi skapa tydlighet i vilka möjligheter du har att utvecklas i den inriktning du vill. Det är viktigt att hela livet fungerar och därför är vi måna om att våra medarbetare upplever en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi är övertygade om att mångfald och inkludering leder till nytänkande, förbättrade affärsresultat och ökat engagemang.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att representera mångfalden bland våra kunder och samhället vi verkar i och uppmuntrar därmed kvinnliga sökanden till denna tjänst.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Christian Falck på christian.falck@vattenfall.com eller 072 553 07 61. Fackliga representanter för denna tjänst är Anne-Marie Sjöbohm Akademikerna, Christian Ericsson Ledarna, Ulf Tengman SEKO, Asim Nokic Unionen. Alla kontaktpersoner nås via Vattenfalls växel 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Ansök senast 4 februari 2025. Har du några frågor om din ansökan, kontakta rekryterare Carolina Osterman, carolina.osterman@vattenfall.com.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vattenfall Eldistribution AB är ett av Sveriges största elnätsföretag och levererar el till ungefär 850 000 privat- och företagskunder. Läs mer på vattenfalleldistribution.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid.

title: Team Lead Product Analytics
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Data domain
 





 The Data domain is part of the Product and Tech function with the mission of transforming Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.
 








**About the role
 





 As Trustly’s lead for Product Analytics you will be instrumental in driving data-informed product decisions, uncovering insights, and ultimately contributing to the success of our products. You will be a strategic partner to our CPO and Head of Product but also work closely with our product managers, designers and engineers driving product adoption and performance.
 









 As a Lead you will have staff responsibility for the Product Analytics team currently composed of four experienced data analysts. You will own and prioritize the team’s backlog and oversee deliveries as well as refine our analytics methodology. You will work closely with our data professionals in order to support your team with the necessary tools and data availability.
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* **Influence product roadmap:** 
 Collaborate closely with product managers to define key product metrics and to ensure data is a core aspect of any product development initiative; based on stakeholder needs, you will propose and prioritize impactful data solutions such as dashboards, deep dives, A/B tests, or machine learning models to drive decision-making and innovation
* **Develop and refine our analytics methodology:** 
 Establish best practices for data tracking, defining key metrics and proactively developing a framework for analyzing and understanding user behavior and product performance; ensure your team has timely access to accurate, well-structured data to address critical business questions and drive informed decision-making
* **Champion the "test and learn" approach:** 
 Promote A/B tests to validate hypotheses, optimize product features, and measure the impact of changes with the aim to establish a robust experimentation framework to ensure our product decisions are backed by data
* **Be a data evangelist:** 
 Foster a data-driven culture within the Product and Tech organization and beyond, advocating for data literacy and promoting the use of data to improve our products



  




**Who you are** 
* Hold a degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent, followed by at least 5 years of hands-on advanced analytics as a data analyst, data scientist or similar
* At least one previous experience in a leadership role
* Experience, or at least a general understanding of the most common analytics methodologies (scalable dashboard, data science, a/b tests etc.)
* Technically skilled to be able to develop our analytics methodology (BI tools, SQL, Vertex AI, Sagemaker or similar tools)
* Strong communication skills to align with stakeholders on your team’s deliverables and roadmap
* A genuine interest in payment solutions






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.****

title: Operatör teknisk säkerhetsunderrättelsetjänst
description:
134. Funktionsskvadron inhämtar genom olika metoder säkerhetsunderrättelser rörande hot mot Försvarsmaktens skyddsvärda tillgångar som exempelvis; information, personal eller verksamhet. Vi söker nu personal som efter uttagningstester och utbildning kommer arbeta som teknisk operatör inom säkerhetsunderrättelsetjänst.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Det dagliga arbetet är i stor utsträckning omväxlande och innefattar allt från teoretisk problemlösning i kontorsmiljö till operativ tjänst i fält. Du förväntas lösa komplexa tekniska uppgifter enskilt såväl som i grupp, ibland under längre tid. Tjänsteresor inom och utom landet är förekommande vilket kan innebära perioder av bortavaro, ibland uppkomna på kort varsel.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är officer eller civil med en bred teknisk förståelse och vill arbeta praktiskt med tekniska problemlösningar inom områdena radioteknik, mekanik och elarbeten. Vi är övertygade att en blandning av människor med olika bakgrund skapar en dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö. Vi ser därför gärna sökande av alla kön och med olika bakgrund och livserfarenhet.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Genomförd GMU/GU/vpl
* Körkort B
* Fyskrav: FMFysS med tilläggsprov nivå 2


**Meriterande**
 Högskoleutbildning eller dokumenterad erfarenhet inom något av följande områden; radioteknik, mekanik, elektronik, mätteknik, akustik, IT-säkerhet, teknisk bevakning eller elarbete. Även utbildning inom mätteknik, elektronik, mekanik eller byggteknik är av intresse. Gärna att du kommer med några års erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av dessa områden.
   

  

 Har du militär bakgrund ser vi att du genomfört specialistofficersutbildning eller officersutbildning, gärna med inriktning mot teknisk officer. Praktiska kunskaper från Försvarsmaktens tekniska system samt tjänstgöring inom teknisk bevakning är meriterande.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Det dagliga arbetet är omväxlande och utmanande vilket ställer höga krav psykisk uthållighet med förmågan att arbeta långsiktigt. Du behöver även vara självgående och ha ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt samtidigt som du har förmågan att arbeta i grupp. En väsentlig del av informationshanteringen är av känslig karaktär, varvid vi ställer höga krav på̊ omdöme och integritet. Din personlighet, dina kunskaper och ditt gedigna intresse för teknik är viktigt för oss. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Specialistofficer (OR7) eller Civil
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: heltid
   

  

 Arbetsort: Kungsängen
   

  

 Tillträdesdatum: Augusti 2025
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen och information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 Personalchef 134.FSkv: 070-301 96 15 (mån-fre 08:00-15:00)
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare:**
 Facklig förtroendeman OFR/O; Alexander Westberg
   

  

 nås via växeln på 08 584 540 00
   

  

*Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-02-10 Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev, där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning. Din ansökan ska också innehålla foto, referenser och personuppgifter.*
**Ansökan skickas med brev till följande adress:**
 Livgardet
   

  

 Op TEK
   

  

 196 85 Kungsängen
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocess**
 Rekryteringsprocessen består av flera delsteg, däribland intervjuer och lämplighetstester. Kallelse till intervju och tester sker från 2025-02-11.
   

  

* Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Livgardet är ett av Försvarsmaktens största förband med anor från 1521. Vi utbildar morgondagens soldater, liksom militärpoliser och personal som ska genomföra internationell insats. Vi bevakar de kungliga slotten, vi har säkerhets- och markstridsförband. Vi ansvarar också för att bevara och utveckla svensk militärmusiktradition. Vårt huvudsäte är i Kungsängen utanför Stockholm, men vi finns också i Sollentuna, i centrala Stockholm, Uppsala, Göteborg och Karlskrona. Inom Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård samt bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Senior Project Manager - Scania Pilot Partner
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Scania Pilot Partner is the company within the company where we explore new technologies in partnership with paying customers. Together we drive the shift to sustainable solutions by introducing future technologies now. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are currently looking for a senior project manager that will scale our first concept pilots for eMining vehicles in a higher volume in what we call Small Series.
   

  

 The Pilot vehicles are developed and tested in small volumes for selected customers with virgin technology and dedicated support from our sister team. In the small series phase we will continue with selected customers and operation but there is a need to scale production, purchasing and aftermarket capabilities as well as handling regulatory aspects.
   

  

 In order to meet the high demand on lead time and internal resource constraints. We will most likely will partner up with external suppliers of solutions, components and production capabilities in order to reach the project mission.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Scale existing Scania Pilots in to a Small Series Launch including product, sales and aftermarket support
* Coordinate internal and external resources from Purchasing, Production, R&D and S&M in order to deliver small series products (eMining 8x4 for Australia is the first project)
* Secure that the solutions is in line with what we promise our customers this means that you must be close to both the customer needs and our internal and external capabilities to deliver.
* Manage cost, revenues and deliveries according to plan in the project
* Support management team with defining the Smal Series Concepts for eMining trucks
* Share insights and inspire all stakeholders in the Scania Pilot Partner Community


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced project manager who excels at driving progress in a large corporate environment with many stakeholders. You understand the complexities of introducing new initiatives and methods in a well-established organization. You can create structure and see how we can make use of Scania processes where it goes, but can also transform and adjust them where needed. You are proactive in seeking solutions to challenges and innovative in finding ways to overcome obstacles.
   

  

 As a person, you are committed and structured and you like a fast pace. You enjoy working independently but with the team's performance in focus. You are outgoing and have good ability to develop and maintain a wide network of contacts at all levels, and are comfortable with presenting and reporting for larger groups. You are communicative in Swedish and have high level of English in speech and writing.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We are a very diverse team of Project/Concept managers situated in Södertälje and Sao Paulo. We all have very long Scania experience working with various senior roles at Scania. We have a truly genuine supporting culture were we help and guide each other. If we see a problem we like to solve it. If we see an opportunity we like to grab it. We work very tight with the Sales and Operation functions at Pilot Partner with employees in Germany, Australia, Brazil and Sweden.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-29. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Kaj Hanson, Director Solution Development, kaj.hanson@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Test Lead for Lumera Delivery and Integration \u007C SEB Life, Stockholm
description:
Join us to lead critical testing for Lumera, shaping the next-gen insurance system with seamless integrations and quality.  

Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. Life & Pension in SEB is one of the largest pensions and insurance providers in Sweden, serving both corporate and private customers. Our offering consists of products and services for important life events, creating certainty in an uncertain future. As a subsidiary in a large financial services group, we benefit from the advantages of a small company—giving you as an employee the ability to influence—while enjoying the possibilities for development and growth that a large company provides.  

  

**About the role**  

As our Test Lead for Lumera Delivery and Integration, your responsibilities will include:
* Test strategy and planning: Implement our test strategy and plan for Lumera system deliveries and integrations.

  

* Test execution and coordination: Manage and lead testing efforts, ensuring smooth collaboration across teams.
* Defect management: Identify, document, and prioritize issues to ensure timely resolutions and delivery quality.
* Environment and data setup: Oversee test environment configurations and manage test data to enable seamless testing processes.
* Stakeholder collaboration: Act as the main testing point of contact, ensuring alignment with development teams, project managers, and business stakeholders.
* Continuous improvement: Analyze testing processes and outcomes to identify areas for improvement and enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* You should have proven experience as a Test Lead, Test Manager, or in a similar role, particularly within system delivery and integration projects.
* Solid understanding of test methodologies, tools, and frameworks, including both manual and automated testing approaches.
* Familiarity with Lumera Core or similar insurance administration systems is advantageous.
* Strong skills in defect tracking, test case management, and test reporting, with tools such as JIRA, Azure DevOps, or similar platforms.
* Experience in managing and coordinating test environments and data preparation.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and convey testing insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* A proactive mindset with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* For the right person, this role offers great opportunities to grow and contribute to both the testing discipline and the broader delivery and integration efforts for Lumera.

### **What we offer:**

* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions, and points of view

Do you want to be part of SEB?  

Welcome with your application! Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2nd of February 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact IT Manager Laban Bondesson at laban.bondesson@seb.se.  

  

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: DevOps Expert
description:
### **Assignment Description**


**Azure Cloud Expertise:**


* Design, build, and manage scalable, secure, and cost-efficient infrastructure on **Microsoft Azure.**
* Utilize Azure services like **Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Functions, Azure APIM, Azure Databricks, Azure Key Vault.**
* Manage resource provisioning, scaling, and cost optimization using Azure tools.


**Containerization and Orchestration:**


* Deploy and manage containerized applications using **Docker.**
* Design and maintain **Helm charts** for Kubernetes resource configuration.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes clusters, ensuring reliability, scalability, and security.


**Event-Driven Systems:**


* Leverage sidecar patterns like **Dapr** to build event-driven microservices and data models.
* Deploy and integrate pub/sub messaging components like **Azure Service Bus, Event Grid,** or **Kafka** for efficient event routing and processing.
* Ensure scalability and fault tolerance by implementing resilient infrastructure for event-driven workloads.


**CI/CD Pipelines:**


* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using **GitHub Actions.**
* Automate build, test, and deployment workflows for multiple environments.
* Optimize pipelines for performance and ensure compliance with best practices.


**Disaster Recovery and Backup Management:**


* Test and refine recovery plans to minimize downtime in case of failures.
* Design and implement robust disaster recovery and backup solutions to ensure business continuity.


**Security Implementation:**


* Implement DevSecOps practices, including integrating security tools into CI/CD pipelines.
* Manage secrets and sensitive information securely using **Azure Key Vault** and similar tools.
* Perform vulnerability assessments and ensure adherence to compliance standards.
* Enforce **OWASP security standards** to address common web application vulnerabilities such as **SQL injection, XSS, CSRF,** and more.


**Monitoring and Incident Management:**


* Set up monitoring and alerting systems using tools like **Splunk, Prometheus**, and **Grafana**.
* Ensure high availability and reliability of applications and services with proactive incident management.


**Collaboration and Support:**


* Collaborate with developers to enhance application performance and deploy code seamlessly.
* Provide expertise in troubleshooting infrastructure and application issues.

title: Build Engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
emagine is looking for our client a skilled Build Engineer to join our clients build and deploy team.


This is a junior role so 3-5 years of experience is preferable.

**Start: ASAP**

**Duration: 6 months**

**Location: Stockholm - hybrid setup**

**Other: Consultant must be based in Stockholm**


This team plays a critical role in developing and maintaining installers for all of our clients products. Additionally, the team manages, configures, and maintains the CI/CD platform, TeamCity.


The build environment is complex, with numerous dependencies across software projects


that require careful oversight and management.


To thrive in this role, you should have strong logical reasoning skills and excellent written and


verbal communication abilities, particularly when collaborating with developers and other


stakeholders.

**Requirements**

* Some form of post-secondary education in Tech (B.Sc, KY, etc.)
* Knowledge and practical experience with PowerShell and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD platforms (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, etc.)
* Experience with Git and similar developer tooling
* Strong communication and collaboration skills

**Highly Meritorious**

* Deep knowledge of Git
* Experience with InstallShield and MSI packaging
* Knowledge of TeamCity specifically
* Experience with CI/CD for C++ (e.g., VCPKG, etc.)
* Experience with CI/CD for .NET (e.g., NuGet, etc.)

title: Devops Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Competence description:**

* **Azure Cloud Expertise:**

* Utilize Azure services like **Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Functions, Azure APIM, Azure Databricks, Azure Key Vault,**
* Manage resource provisioning, scaling, and cost optimization using Azure tools.

* **Containerization and Orchestration:**
* Deploy and manage containerized applications using **Docker.**
* Design and maintain **Helm charts** for Kubernetes resource configuration.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes clusters, ensuring reliability, scalability, and security.

* **Event-Driven Systems:**
* Leverage sidecar patterns like **Dapr** to build event-driven microservices and data models
* Deploy and integrate pub/sub messaging components like **Azure Service Bus, Event Grid,** or **Kafka** for efficient event routing and processing.
* Ensure scalability and fault tolerance by implementing resilient infrastructure for event-driven workloads

* **CI/CD Pipelines:**
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using **GitHub Actions.**
* Automate build, test, and deployment workflows for multiple environments.
* Optimize pipelines for performance and ensure compliance with best practices.

* **Disaster Recovery and Backup Management:**
* Test and refine recovery plans to minimize downtime in case of failures.
* Design and implement robust disaster recovery and backup solutions to ensure business continuity.

* **Security Implementation:**
* Implement DevSecOps practices, including integrating security tools into CI/CD pipelines.
* Manage secrets and sensitive information securely using **Azure Key Vault** and similar tools.
* Perform vulnerability assessments and ensure adherence to compliance standards.
* Enforce **OWASP security standards** to address common web application vulnerabilities such as **SQL injection, XSS, CSRF,** and more.

* **Monitoring and Incident Management:**
* Set up monitoring and alerting systems using tools like **Splunk, Prometheus**, and **Grafana**.
* Ensure high availability and reliability of applications and services with proactive incident management.

* **Collaboration and Support:**
* Collaborate with developers to enhance application performance and deploy code seamlessly.
* Provide expertise in troubleshooting infrastructure and application iss

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 22-01-2025  

  

**About Us**

title: Microsoft Azure DevOps (ADO) Specialist
description:
**Description**
---------------


Get the opportunity to work in the largest insurance company in the Nordics. We enable almost four million customers to live their fullest lives by always being by their side if something unexpected happens. Insurance is all about life and creating great digital journeys. Software development could be so much better and so much smoother.


### **Requirements**

* 2 years or more with Azure DevOps as a company-wide project collections administrator or equivalent.
* Strong understanding of Microsoft Azure services and cloud technologies.
* Fluently in English, spoken and written.
* Familiarity with vendor tools and application development technologies.

### **Responsibilities**

* Clear communication is crucial when interacting with users, colleagues, and vendors. Explain technical concepts in a way that non-technical users can understand.
* IT System specialists encounter various issues daily. Being able to diagnose problems, troubleshooting efficiently, and finding effective solutions is essential.
* Technology evolves rapidly. An adaptable specialist can handle changes, updates, and new tools effectively.
* Precise configuration, security settings, and documentation are critical. Attention to detail prevents costly mistakes.
* Prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and respond promptly to incidents.
* Treat users with patience and empathy. Excellent customer service enhances user satisfaction.
* Understand security best practices and proactively protect systems from threats.

### **What we offer:**

* Opportunities for personal and professional growth in global environment.
* Flexible working schedule and opportunity to work remotely.
* Talented colleagues.
* The exchange of experience.

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
Are you a senior data engineer ready to design and build data platforms at scale for global impact? We’re looking for a **Data Engineering Lead** to establish world-class practices and infrastructure for our AI and data initiatives.
**Join our team!**  


We’re building cutting-edge AI and data solutions at a global scale, designed for production and impact. As a newly established and dynamic hub, we are passionate about driving innovation and empowering our entire organization to unlock new possibilities with data and AI. We thrive on collaboration, value fresh ideas, and are excited to tackle challenges that shape the future. If you're ready to be part of a team that's pushing boundaries and delivering real-world results, we’d love to hear from you!  


**Your mission**  


In this role, you’ll:  


* Be **hands-on**, designing and building scalable, production-ready data pipelines and platforms using modern tools and frameworks.
* **Tame diverse data sources**, adapting creatively and quickly to changing business needs and data landscapes.
* Drive **end-to-end data engineering solutions**, from architecture design to implementation.
* Define and establish **ways of working (WoWs)**, ensuring best practices for data engineering.
* Mentor and coach team members, helping to grow a collaborative and high-performing data engineering team.


**Your profile**  


We are seeking a highly motivated and self-driven individual who excels in working independently with minimal supervision. You should demonstrate a creative approach to problem-solving and possess a "go-getter" attitude, always striving to find solutions and overcome challenges. Exceptional interpersonal communication skills are essential, enabling you to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.  


You aso bring:  


* Expert-level proficiency in **Python**, SQL, and modern data frameworks (e.g., Spark, Kafka, Snowflake, etc.).
* A degree in **Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related field** (Master’s preferred).
* Extensive experience working with **large-scale data systems** in global organizations.
* A strong foundation in **cloud platforms** (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and DevOps practices.
* **Problem-solving creativity** to manage and integrate varied data sources in dynamic environments.
* Experience in **supply chain data systems** is a **bonus** but not required.


This is an **individual contributor role** with the potential for future management responsibilities. If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves, lead by example, and build data platforms that enable AI innovation at scale, we want to hear from you!  


**Life at Epiroc**  


By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, some things make us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc. Find out more at  

https://www.epirocgroup.com/en/work-at-epiroc  


**Location and travel**  


The location for this role is Örebro or Stockholm, Sweden. Occasional travel may be required. If a candidate from another country applies and is successful, local terms and conditions will apply.  

**Application and contacts**  


In this recruitment process, we review applications continuously. We welcome your application as soon as possible, by creating an account in our recruitment system. The last day to apply for this position is 05/02/2025.  

We are committed to a thorough recruitment process, including interviews, reference checks and assessments. To ensure a safe working environment, we conduct identity checks and drug and alcohol screening. Our process is designed to be fair and inclusive; you can expect transparent communication and a balanced evaluation of your skills and experience.  


**For questions about the position, please contact:**  


Hiring manager Luba Weissmann, AI Director, luba.weissmann@epiroc.com OR Recruitment Specialist Zuzana Kalivodova, zuzana.kalivodova@epiroc.com.  



**Epiroc** is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epiroc.com.

title: Cloud Advisory Manager
description:
**Would you like to shape transformational projects and define cutting edge, cloud-based solutions, solving our clients' most complex issues?**


As a part of our **Cloud Advisory** practice, you will be joining Nordic’s ’s leading technology cloud advisory group. You will assist clients in matching their business and IT goals and find ways to use innovative cloud technology for better business value and cost savings. Your passion and talent will play a key role in advising client management in achieving greater business value from cloud technology.


The role is part of the Nordic team consisting of 14 people with diverse backgrounds, united by the passion for cloud technology and business value. We place a strong emphasis on creating a collaborative work environment, diverse community, and maintaining work life balance. With us, you will have the opportunity to work with large scale digital-driven business transformations and serve as trusted advisor for C-level in leading Nordic companies.

  

We at **Cloud Advisory** help our clients become industry leaders. With our cross-expertise in cloud technology transformation and management consulting, we work closely with our clients to find their focus areas in the market and identify organizational and cloud technological building blocks to reach the target state. We are helping our clients to create sustainable and digital change for the future to identify value across financial, experience, sustainability, talent, and inclusion & diversity dimensions.

**Some examples of areas you could work with:**

* Advise clients on how to develop their business by leveraging emerging and established cloud technologies
* Create effective operating models to transform and build organizations ready for growth and stability
* Unlock the value of data, architecture, and AI to drive business agility and transformation to a real-time enterprise
* Identify, quantify, maximize, and sustain value realization from cloud technology investments
* Plan, organize and execute cloud transformation programs
* … and much more!

**How do you know this could be the role for you?**


We are looking for you who has minimum 8 years relevant experience either from other consultancy companies, large-scale business development, strategy development and implementation in technology driven organizations, or hands on experience with larger-scale cloud transformation. You have a deep business understanding of one or more industries and a proven ability to challenge and transform traditional ways of working by leveraging new cloud technologies, innovative business models and agile ways of working. You excel in leading the development and implementation of strategies that bring transformative ideas and innovations to life.


You are fluent in business case generation, value and cost driver identification and operating model creation.


As a person, you are analytical with a structural mindset that drives impressive results and thrive in environments where you define, organize, and solve clients' complex challenges. In addition to delivering outcomes, you lead and develop high-performing teams, fostering growth and empowering others to succeed. You inherently know the cloud advantages and what they mean in practice, and also the associated impacts and pitfalls. Fluency in English is mandatory, fluency in local language and experience with frameworks such DevOps, SAFe, Lean portfolio management, TOGAF and ITIL is highly desirable.


  

The position will report to **Managing Director** **Cloud Advisory, and workplace is the capital city of your home country in the Nordics.**

**Interested?**

**Apply online by attaching your CV, application letter, and educational diplomas as soon as possible.** We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. **We look forward to receiving your application!**


Please reach out to us if you have any questions concerning this position.

title: Test Engineer - Financial Services
description:
**Description du poste:**
-------------------------


r du vass p test, har ett gediget intresse fr teknik och vill f mjligheten att frndra och frbttra samhllet vi lever i? Nu sker vi en Test Engineer med bank- och/eller frskringsbakgrund till enheten Financial Services i Stockholm.  

  

Som Test Engineer hos oss p CGI fr du mjlighet att vara med och frndra p riktigt. Du fr skapa lsningar tillsammans med vra kunder, som bidrar till att skapa hllbara resultat fr det samhlle vi lever i. Det kan handla om att skapa effektiva och innovativa lsningar som hjlper vra kunder att leverera bttre service, ka sin skerhet eller effektivisera sin verksamhet.  

  

Vi erbjuder en spnnande roll med nra kundsamarbeten, stor insikt i affren, stort kontaktnt, varierande och utvecklande arbetsuppgifter. Inom vra taganden strvar vi efter en milj dr vi stttar varandra och har roligt p dagarna. Om du tycker att detta lter spnnande s tveka inte att ska.


**Fonctions et responsabilits:**
--------------------------------


Att jobba som konsult p CGI innebr en omvxlande vardag. Hr erbjuds du mjlighet att utvecklas som konsult bde i lokala kundleveranser och i strre globala taganden. Du kan jobba i sm, korta projekt p ngra mnader till stora, lnga taganden dr du kan vxa inom samma leverans och pverka dina arbetsuppgifter och roll. Vi deltar i och driver projekt och taganden p plats hos vra kunder, men frmst frn vra lokala kontor eller p distans. Vi arbetar svl enskilt som tillsammans med andra kollegor i vra projekt. Vra uppdrag genomfrs med std av etablerade metoder och modeller som baseras p branschstandarder.  

  

Som Test Engineer kommer du att ansvara fr att tester planeras och genomfrs i enlighet med kravstllning samt prioriteringar av det agila teamets produktgare. Vi arbetar nra varandra inom teamet, och stttar givetvis varandra i vrt arbete.  

  

I dina arbetsuppgifter kan fljande ing:  

Manuell testning planera, skriva och genomfra testfall  

Testledning ta fram teststrategier, testplaner och leda testarbetet  

Automatiserade tester planera och skapa tester i lmpligt testverktyg
  

Front-end test  

Back-end test  

API-testning  

Integrationstestning


**Qualits requises pour russir dans ce rle:**
---------------------------------------------


Fr att lyckas i rollen som Test Engineer sker vi dig som tycker om att stta dig in i komplexa tekniska lsningar, se samband och flden och utifrn det skapa och utfra testfall som utmanar utvecklarnas lsningar. Den vi sker knner sig ocks hemma i den finansiella sektorn, bank och/eller frskring, och har tidigare arbetet med test inom branschen. Det r viktigt att du r en lagspelare d du kommer arbeta ttt ihop med utvecklarna i teamet det ven viktigt att du r sjlvgende och har ltt att ta till dig en helhet. Noggrannhet och struktur r andra viktiga egenskaper som vrdestts hgt. Du kan ven flytande svenska, i tal och skrift.  

  

Vi nskar grna att du utver test har erfarenhet frn/inom:  

Agilt arbetsstt  

Continuous Integration  

Systemutveckling (fr att kunna skapa automatiserade tester)  

  

Det r en frdel om du har erfarenhet av fljande verktyg som anvnds inom det dagliga arbetet:  

Gitlab  

Jira inklusive Zephyr
  

Azure devops
  

Confluence  

Cucumber  

Postman  

Selenium  

Cypress  

Playwright  

UiPath  

Tosca
  

Git  

  

Det r ocks meriterande om du har testcertifiering ssom ISTQB.  

  

**Vill du veta mer?**  

Vi ser fram emot att hra frn dig! Anskningar utvrderas lpande, och tjnsten kan komma att tillsttas tidigare. Om det fortfarande finns ngot du undrar ver, skicka grna dina funderingar till Emma De Mont (emma.de.mont@cgi.com)  

  

Resor kan ing i rollen. Personliga skerhetskrav kommer att krvas om rollen krver det.  

  

**Vad kan vi p CGI erbjuda dig?**  

CGIs kombination av global och lokal nrvaro, med kontor p 30 orter i Sverige, ger njda kunder men innebr ven att du som anstlld alltid har ett kontor nra dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig mjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.  

  

P CGI finns ven stora mjligheter till interna karrirvgar dr du kan vlja att bli specialist inom ditt omrde, bredda dig inom nya omrden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via vra interna ntverk, projekt och taganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stttar just dig i din utveckling.  

  

Mer information om vra frmner:  

Aktieprogram och delgarskap: Som delgare har du mjlighet att pverka och i vrt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona fr krona upp till 3% av din mnadsln.  

Friskvrdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett rligt friskvrdsbidrag p 4 000 kr.  

Frldraln: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din ln under den frsta tiden hemma.  

Trygg anstllning: Vra konsulter anstlls med kollektivavtal och frskringar.  

Pensionslsningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och frmnliga pensionslsningar.  

Personalbil: Personalbilen anvnds som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.  

  

#LI-JA1


**Ce que vous pouvez attendre de nous:**
----------------------------------------


**Lt oss som gare omvandla verklig insikt till handling tillsammans.**  

  

Livet p CGI bygger p gande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhrighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna n din fulla potential.  

  

Du r inbjuden att ta gandeskap redan frn frsta dagen i vrt arbete med att frverkliga vr drm om att skapa en arbetsmilj dr vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgngen fr vrt fretag. Det r drfr vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare n anstllda. Vi drar nytta av vr kollektiva framgng och tillsammans fr vi mjlighet att aktivt forma vr fretagsstrategi och inriktning.  

  

Ditt arbete skapar vrde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lsningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du fr tillgng till globala mjligheter att skala upp dina ider, omfamna nya mjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.  

  

Du kommer att forma din karrir tillsammans med ett fretag som r byggt fr att vxa och best. Du fr std av ledare som bryr sig om din hlsa och ditt vlbefinnande och ger dig mjligheter att frdjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
  

  

Bli en del en av vrldens strsta leverantrer av IT- och affrskonsulttjnster.

* Plan, organize and execute cloud transformation programs
* … and much more!

**How do you know this could be the role for you?**


We are looking for you who has minimum 8 years relevant experience either from other consultancy companies, large-scale business development, strategy development and implementation in technology driven organizations, or hands on experience with larger-scale cloud transformation. You have a deep business understanding of one or more industries and a proven ability to challenge and transform traditional ways of working by leveraging new cloud technologies, innovative business models and agile ways of working. You excel in leading the development and implementation of strategies that bring transformative ideas and innovations to life.


You are fluent in business case generation, value and cost driver identification and operating model creation.


As a person, you are analytical with a structural mindset that drives impressive results and thrive in environments where you define, organize, and solve clients' complex challenges. In addition to delivering outcomes, you lead and develop high-performing teams, fostering growth and empowering others to succeed. You inherently know the cloud advantages and what they mean in practice, and also the associated impacts and pitfalls. Fluency in English is mandatory, fluency in local language and experience with frameworks such DevOps, SAFe, Lean portfolio management, TOGAF and ITIL is highly desirable.


  

The position will report to **Managing Director** **Cloud Advisory, and workplace is the capital city of your home country in the Nordics.**

**Interested?**

**Apply online by attaching your CV, application letter, and educational diplomas as soon as possible.** We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. **We look forward to receiving your application!**


Please reach out to us if you have any questions concerning this position.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what we burn for. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing and settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product oriented DevOps engineer to team up with one of our empowered product DevOps teams.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 




 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for:
 


* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations.
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives, adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach.
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule.



  





 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
 



  





**What makes you stand out** 



* You have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry.
* Are skilled in AWS and micro-services and serverless technologies.
* Are passionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business.
* Highly collaborative, setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others.
* A role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users.
* Are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you.



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also:
 


* Have confirmed experience in software development and coding in various languages including Java, Python, JS, and SQL etc.
* Background in micro-service, high availability and serverless software architecture and design running on AWS distributed over several availability zones and regions.
* As a result, we would like you also to have proficient knowledge in AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, ESC, RDS, Terraform, CloudFormation.
* Jenkins Pipeline and GIT, CI/CD, Release on Demand
* Docker
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field
* Deepened knowledge of software architecture and design including information security and experience from high-available API platforms is
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English and Swedish
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)



  





**Skills we’d like** 



* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com** 




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Cloud Engineer
