title: Cloud Support Technician
description:
Zelly är ett ledande ”born-in-the-cloud” företag . Vi utvecklar och optimerar molntjänster från Microsoft och ser till att våra kunder har tillgång till de bäst lämpade molntjänsterna för deras verksamhet.**Nu har du chansen att hänga med på vår tillväxtresa!**



Vi på Zelly växer och behöver nu en till Cloud Support Technician till Customer Care teamet. Vi söker nu dig som är ambitiös med en positiv inställning. Zelly är ett dynamiskt och snabbväxande Cloud-bolag som levererar alla Microsofts plattformar. Vi har en Cloud first-approach och ser styrkan i att nyttja synergier i Microsofts ekosystem. Zelly är den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som vill utvecklas, gillar att ta ansvar och ha möjligheten att påverka din arbetsplats. Vi ser att du är hungrig på ny teknik, vill hjälpa kunder till en bättre, enklare och säkrare vardag.


**Om rollen**



I supporten har vi daglig kontakt med många av de kunder som använder vår plattform. Kundservice är en central och väsentlig del i vår verksamhet då våra kunders framgång är detsamma som framgång för oss på Zelly. Din främsta uppgift blir att i supporten hantera inkommande ärenden från kunder via ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och mail. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär bland annat felsökning i en Windowsmiljö, konto- och behörighetshantering i Active Directory, Azure AD, Office 365, problemlösning för skrivare, nätverk, dokumentation och en hel del annat. Komplexiteten av ärenden varierar mycket och utvecklingsmöjligheterna är stora.


**Vi söker dig som har:**


* Erfarenhet av att jobba i Servicedesk med IT-support eller teknisk support
* Kunskap inom exempelvis Windows Server, Active Directory, Azure, Office 365, nätverk & hårdvara
* Strukturerad och organiserad
* förmågan att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska
* Genuin passion för IT och digitalisering
* Van att ha mycket kundkontakt


**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du:**


* Är intresserad av cloud produkter och dess utveckling
* Trivs med frihet under ansvar
* Gillar att utveckla rutiner och processer


**Dina möjligheter hos oss:**


* Bra villkor och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett snabbt expanderande IT-bolag!
* Möjlighet till delägarskap i Aderian Group som är koncernen som Zelly ingår i
* Då vårt mål är att du ska bli bäst på molntjänster betalar vi gärna för din fortbildning. För när du utvecklas – utvecklas vi!
* Självklart erbjuder vi både förmåner och bonusar
* Roliga resor och aktiviteter tillsammans!


Rekrytering sker löpande – där tillträde och lön sker enligt överenskommelse. Vi kommer genomföra bakgrundskontrol som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.



Hoppas vi hörs!

title: Enterprise Account Executive, EMEA
description:
**Location**  

We are looking to hire an Enterprise Account Executive anywhere in the UK, Ireland, Estonia, Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland, and Sweden.We are currently only accepting applications from candidates located in these countries.

**About DoiT:**
DoiT is a global technology company that works with cloud-driven organizations to leverage the cloud to drive business growth and innovation. We combine data, technology, and human expertise to ensure you're operating in a well-architected and scalable state - from planning to production.

Delivering DoiT Cloud Intelligence, the only solution that integrates advanced technology with human intelligence, we help you solve complex multicloud problems and drive efficiency.

With decades of multicloud experience, we have specializations in Kubernetes, GenAI, CloudOps, and more. An award-winning strategic partner of AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure, we work alongside more than 4,000 customers worldwide.

**The Opportunity**  

As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will apply best-in-class pipeline generation, deal management, solution pitching, negotiation, and closing skills to drive the growth of DoiT's product across enterprise and mid-market prospects with over $1m+ in monthly cloud spend. You will champion the proprietary technology that DoiT provides to customers, and bring opportunities through the full sales cycle. Using your passion, you help spread the magic of DoiT to organizations everywhere.

**Responsibilities**
* Deliver against assigned sales and pipeline goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our prospects
* Build out territory plan for DoiT technology sales, specifically around DoiT's proprietary products.
* Partnering with the Solution Engineering team to drive solutions focused sales conversations with prospects that highlight the value of DoiT's product and service offering.
* Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle
* Refine the customer sales cycle, focusing on reducing friction to buy, and speeding adoption of DoiT Cloud Intelligence™
* Contribute to territory strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities
* Explore and understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level
* Collaborate with DoiT marketing team members on pipeline generation campaigns, driving attendance to events, and ensuring DoiT hears the true voice of the customer.
**Qualifications**
* BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5+ years of quota-carrying sales experience in Enterprise SaaS and a consistent record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas
* Technically minded, with experience and understanding of the public cloud ecosystem and cloud management technologies
* High degree of self-discipline, accurate sales forecasting and salesforce hygiene
* "Roll up your sleeves" perspective that pervades both sales as well as business development and top of funnel activities
* An entrepreneur at heart who is independent, creative, passionate and approachable
* Self-organized, Goal-oriented, self-motivated individual who is confident, thorough, and tenacious
* Analytical, Data-driven, detail-oriented and able to "zoom" in/out from the big picture to the minutiae.
* Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal


**Are you a Do'er?**  

Be your truest self. Work on your terms. Make a difference.



We are home to a global team of incredible talent who work remotely and have the flexibility to have a schedule that balances your work and home life. We embrace and support leveling up your skills professionally and personally.

What does being a Do'er mean? We're all about being entrepreneurial, pursuing knowledge and having fun! Click here to learn more about our core values.

Sounds too good to be true? Check out our Glassdoor Page.
We thought so too, but we're here and happy we hit that 'apply' button.
* Unlimited Vacation
* Flexible Working Options
* Health Insurance
* Parental Leave
* Employee Stock Option Plan
* Home Office Allowance
* Professional Development Stipend
* Peer Recognition Program
**Many Do'ers, One Team**
DoiT unites as *Many Do'ers, One Team*, where diversity is more than a goal—it's our strength. We actively cultivate an inclusive, equitable workplace, recognizing that each unique perspective enhances our innovation. By celebrating differences, we create an environment where every individual feels valued, contributing to our collective success.
#LI-Remote
company_description: We help cloud-driven organizations understand and harness the cloud to drive business growth.  We do this by providing intelligent technology and continuous engagement with unrivaled cloud expertise.

title: Front Office Team Leader
description:
Brinner du för att skapa förstklassig service, vara ansiktet utåt och vara med och utveckla hotellets hjärta? Har du dessutom erfarenhet från reception och känner att det är dags för nästa kliv framåt? Nu har du chansen att bli en del av oss på Hotel Riverton AB, som är ett framåtriktat och familjeägt designhotell. Nyfiken? Läs mer om tjänsten och vem vi söker!
  
Team LeaderI rollen som Team Leader kommer ditt huvudsakliga ansvar vara att driva och utveckla den dagliga driften i receptionen och se till att allt fungerar så friktionsfritt som möjligt. Du kommer ha ett operativt ansvar med fokus att ta hand om våra gäster på bästa sätt. Du kommer också planera för den dagliga driften och fördela arbetsuppgifter till dina kollegor i receptionen. Förutom sedvanliga arbetsuppgifter som ingår i en reception, ingår det också att coacha, stötta och utbilda dina kollegor och skapa arbetsglädje. Vi arbetar i Opera Cloud, som är den senaste och mer innovativa versionen av Opera PMS. Tjänsten motsvarar heltid och innefattar kvällar och helger enligt rullande schema.
  
  

**Du kommer bland annat:**  

Planera och fördela dagliga arbetet
  
Stötta, inspirera och utbilda personal
  
Utveckla och förbättra processer och rutiner
  
In- och utcheckning av gäster
  
Hantera inkommande samtal och mejl
  
Ta emot bokningar
  
Faktura- och kassahantering
  
Aktivt arbeta mot avdelningens mål
  
Merförsäljning
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig?Vi erbjuder dig en familjär arbetsplats med hjärta, där vi verkligen värdesätter vår personal och strävar efter att skapa en personlig, behaglig och engagerad atmosfär. För oss är det viktigt att varje människa känner sig fri att vara sig själv och skapa förutsättningar för kompetensutveckling här hos oss. Vem söker vi?Vi söker dig som är trygg i dig själv och brinner för att leverera förstklassig service. För att lyckas i rollen som Team Leadersöker vi dig med tydligt servicefokus, administrativ förmåga och med en vilja att sträva framåt. Du trivs i en ledande roll där du inspirerar och coachar dina medarbetare och tillsammans arbetar för att nå gemensamma mål. Som person har du hög social kompetens och har lätt för att kommunicera på ett trevligt sätt både via telefon, mejl eller över receptionsdisken. Du förstår vikten av nöjda kunder och att snabbt agera och hantera eventuellt missnöje. Då det tidvis kan innebära hög arbetsbelastning är det viktigt att du har förmågan att prioritera och fokusera under press och samtidigt kan ta snabba beslut.
  
Hotel Riverton ABHotel Riverton är ett familjeägt och drivet designhotell beläget vid vattnet i centrala Göteborg. Vi lägger stor vikt på vår personal, på dig som individ, dina kunskaper och egenskaper. Vår största konkurrensfördel är utan tvekan vår organisation med dess individuella personligheter, men också att vi värdesätter moderna arbetsverktyg. Under år 2019/2020 valde vi att göra en större investering för att utveckla ett starkt och attraktivt koncept för framtiden inom hotell, restaurang, konferens, gym och spa. I samband med renoveringen genomgick vi också en re-branding av företaget för att bygga ett starkare varumärke på framtiden. Nu behöver vi förstärka vår front office med en Team Leader, för att komplettera vårt team.
  
Krav
  
Flerårig erfarenhet som hotellreceptionist
  
Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
Erfarenhet från bokningssystem (gärna Opera PMS)
  
  

Meriterande
  
Erfarenhet som Team leader
  
  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.
  
  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:** 2025-02-15
  
**Tillträde:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Tjänst:** Heltid
  
**Ort:** Göteborg
  
Platsa ansvarar för rekryteringen av denna tjänst. Vid en anställning blir du anställd direkt av vår kund. Eventuella frågor hänvisas direkt till ansvarig rekryterare:
  
Evelina Löfberg, civ. ek, evelina.lofberg@platsa.se, 0733-28 18 60

title: Senior Technical Specialist- Industry Data Platform
description:
Are you a seasoned technician with a passion for system administration, development, and application management? Are you excited by the challenge of working in a mixed environment with diverse tasks and responsibilities? If so, we want you to be part of our innovative team!
  
At Industry Data Platform, we're searching for a Senior Technical Specialist who is not only technically proficient but also embodies the values of humility, flexibility, and service-mindedness. Our ideal candidate thrives in dynamic settings and brings a creative problem-solving attitude to the table.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
  

Manage and optimize Linux clusters
  
Utilize FTP, NFS, and various communication protocols for seamless operations
  
Troubleshoot complex issues across multiple applications
  
Maintain systems for monitoring and observability
  
Administer Windows servers
  
Implement and manage network load balancing
  
  

Required Experience
  
  

**Several years of expertise in:**  

Bash Scripting
  
MySQL/MariaDB and Maxscale clusters
  
  

Beneficial Skills
  
Knowledge of HA Proxy
  
Experience with Docker Swarm
  
Proficiency in PHP
  
Familiarity with Kubernetes
  
Understanding of Zabbix
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
**Impactful Work:** Engage in troubleshooting customer-specific issues and contribute to significant projects like application migrations, container scaling, and cluster optimization for databases and production servers.
  
**Cutting-Edge Environment:** Work primarily with Linux and Windows servers. Be part of our strategic shift towards cloud integration to enhance efficiency and scalability.
  
**Collaborative Culture:** Join a team dedicated to developing and maintaining a robust technical environment that powers document production and processing for hundreds of clients.
  
**Opportunities for Growth:** Contribute to high-impact projects and leverage new technologies to drive business goals.
  
  

About Us
  
Our team at Tietoevry Industry is focused on optimizing and maintaining our platforms to efficiently process data from a multitude of clients. Our environment is multifaceted, with a primary application on Quadient (GMC) Inspire alongside numerous proprietary services.
  
  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
  
Apply Now!
  
Embark on a rewarding career with us where your contributions will make a tangible impact. If you're ready to take on diverse challenges and grow your skills in an innovative environment, apply today! Don't miss this opportunity to become a key player in our exciting journey towards the cloud.
  
If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to hiring manager Kristin Hauge, at kristin.hauge@tietoevry.com, or Lead Talent Acquisition Rojin Amini, at rojin.amini@tietoevry.com.
  
Looking forward to having you on the Tietoevry team!
  
We perform background checks on all final candidates.
  
Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
  
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Head of Corporate Lending
description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, digital yet personal.
  
Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.
  
Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!
  
About the role
  
Northmill Bank is seeking a seasoned Credit Analyst with extensive expertise in real estate financing.The ideal candidate has experience in underwriting large loans secured by real estate, preferably including construction loans, as well as commercial experience managing a portfolio of customers.This role also includes responsibility for the bank's corporate lending department, targeting a 1 billion SEK portfolio growth in 2025.Initially, you will oversee a team of three senior analysts, with the expectation to build and enhance the department's capabilities to ensure efficient and effective operations.You willreport directly to Northmill Bank’s Chief Lending & Analytics Officer and offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on the bank's corporate lending strategy.
  
Responsibilities
  
Underwrite loans secured by real estate, ensuring thorough risk assessment and compliance.
  
Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Corporate Lending Department, driving performance and efficiency.
  
Chair the bank's Credit Underwriting Committee, leading decision-making on loan approvals.
  
Develop and enhance operational capabilities to ensure seamless, efficient, and effective processes.
  
  

Qualifications
  
We are seeking an experienced Credit Analyst with a proven track record in underwriting real estate loans. The ideal candidate brings extensive banking experience and deep expertise in real estate financing.
  
A university degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or Economics.
  
At least 10 years of experience in real estate financing.
  
Strong knowledge of relevant regulations, including the Capital Requirements Directive
  
Proven experience in managing distressed assets and loan workouts.
  
  

**Fun Facts:**  

Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
  
Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”.
  
Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
  
Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
  
Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
  
Stockholm's most beautiful office space that the city has to offer, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.
  
  

Apply today and be a part of Northmill!

title: Senior OT Cybersecurity Architect
description:
*Passionate about designing innovative, sustainable, and competitive cybersecurity solutions? A thought leader? And expert in industrial automation and control systems?*

Then live your passion in a position where you identify and evaluate security gaps, develop and implement security strategies and advise customers on optimal use of security solutions.

**What to expect**

* As our leading solution architect for Industrial and OT cybersecurity you are responsible for maturing our architectural framework and solution approach in securing industrial automation and control systems.
* Joining clients’ digitalization projects e. g. on smart manufacturing or autonomous vehicles you design intelligent security solutions.
* In large transformation programs within converging industrial automation and control systems environments you work on solutions like secure zones, conduits, assets and endpoints, secure maintenance and access controls, secure cloud and I(I)oT, vulnerability and patch management, threat detection and response and security orchestration, automation and response.
* Always striving for the best, you position, leverage, and extend our managed security services and XDR solutions and support sales engagements in solution design.
* With your strong solutions background and business acumen, you act as business-driven innovative thought leader in security solutions for IACS.

  

**What we're looking forward to**

* Professional training in vendor technologies related to IACS or cybersecurity combined with minimum five years’ experience in process and automation technology and/or cybersecurity and ideally also a degree or equivalent in a technical field
* Broad expertise in domains that are relevant for Industrial and OT cybersecurity such as integrated governance and risk management, cloud and IIoT Security, threat detection and response, network security, vulnerability and patch management and familiarity with industry frameworks, standards and regulations
* Experience in designing risk-oriented OT cybersecurity solutions such as IIoT and cloud, maintenance access, segmentation and conduits, and XDR in OT environments
* Excellent consultative selling skills, ability to understand and communicate business benefits and technical advantages of solutions efficiently on technical and commercial levels and a track record in supporting sales engagements in solution design
* Cross-functional and innovative team player and valued leader with analytical and problem-solving strength, the ability to coach others in a matrix structure environment, fluency in both Swedish and English and willingness to travel

  

At Accenture, you work with authentic professionals who have one thing in common: A passion for change. We are constantly on the lookout for new employees who have the personality, knowledge, and skills to make our agile and interdisciplinary teams even better. As facilitators, we use the synergy of technology and human intelligence to spark digital innovation and make the world a little better, too. Join our team and implement innovative solutions that enable our clients to seize the opportunities of digital transformation.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Senior Cybersecuirty Manager Industrial and OT
description:
*When you hear digital control systems and production processes, do you immediately think of cybersecurity? Do you have what it takes to lead a team of consultants and architects? And are you ready for large complex transformation projects?*

Then live your passion in a position where you identify and evaluate security gaps, develop and implement security strategies and advise customers on optimal use of security solutions.

 **What to expect**

* In this demanding role you build, manage, and develop a high performing team of consultants and architects who accompany clients in complex transformation projects to ensure secure digitalization of control systems and production processes.
* As industrial and OT cybersecurity experts you and your team members cover all relevant subject areas such as integrated governance and risk management, cloud and IIoT Security, threat detection and response, network security, or vulnerability and patch management.
* Leading large complex transformation projects within converging industrial automation and control systems environments you challenge our solutions and our people to continually enhance.
* You ensure that technical, consulting, and managed industrial and OT cybersecurity services such as managed GRC across OT/IT or managed secure zones and conduits are considered in sales and proposal creation.
* In client meetings and workshops, you leverage your consultative selling skills.

  

**What we're looking forward to**

* Degree or equivalent plus at least seven years’ experience in process and automation technology and/or cybersecurity, ideally combined with a background in industrial engineering and operational technology
* Broad expertise in domains that are relevant for Industrial and OT cybersecurity such as integrated governance and risk management, cloud and IIoT Security, threat detection and response, network security, vulnerability and patch management and familiarity with industry frameworks, standards, and regulations
* Strong business acumen, a good blend of commercial, sales and technical skills, a consultative mindset, and a proven track record in aligning with customers
* Experience in leading teams, ability to attract and develop cybersecurity talents and to coach others in a matrix structure environment
* Cross-functional and innovative team player with analytical, problem-solving and communication strength, fluency in both Swedish and English and willingness to travel

  

At Accenture, you work with authentic professionals who have one thing in common: A passion for change. We are constantly on the lookout for new employees who have the personality, knowledge, and skills to make our agile and interdisciplinary teams even better. As facilitators, we use the synergy of technology and human intelligence to spark digital innovation and make the world a little better, too. Join our team and implement innovative solutions that enable our clients to seize the opportunities of digital transformation.

title: Sales Development Executive - SAP Concur
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

**SAP C****oncur Info**


SAP Concur imagines the way the world should work, offering cloud-based services that make it simple to manage travel and expenses. By connecting data, applications, and people, SAP Concur delivers an effortless experience and total transparency into spending wherever and whenever it happens, so businesses can focus on what matters most.


The highly rated SAP Concur mobile app guides employees through business trips, charges are directly populated into expense reports, and invoice approvals are automated. By integrating near real-time data and using AI to analyse transactions, businesses can see what they’re spending, ensure compliance, and avoid possible blind spots in the budget. SAP Concur solutions help eliminate yesterday’s tedious tasks, make today’s work easier, and support businesses to run at their best. Learn more at concur.com or the SAP Concur blog*.*

 **Job Overview**


The Sales Development Executive (SDE) is responsible for supporting the Sales and Marketing departments through lead generation. This includes qualification of all inbound and outbound leads via the phone, social selling, web, email, corporate events and direct mail campaigns. The SDR is also responsible for event support and proactive lead generation. The Sales Development reps report to the SDR Manager.

 **What exactly will you do?**

* You will create new qualified opportunities for the Regional Sales Executives with whom you partner. This includes qualification of all inbound and outbound leads via the phone, social selling, email, corporate events and direct mail campaigns.
* You will report to an SDR Manager who values in-the-moment coaching, weekly one-to-one, as well as autonomy to allow you to run your business the way it works for you.
* You own your territory as if you were running your own business. You’re driven to build knowledge of SAP Concur’s product offerings, competitors, and the outcomes our customers seek from our solutions.
* You will confidently overcome objections and face the challenges that come with prospecting and calling head-on. You will effectively communicate Concur’s value propositions to key decision makers.
* You will build and maintain strong relationships with sales and marketing teams through clear, confident communication. You will work professionally and effectively to build cross-functional partnerships.
* You will achieve and exceed weekly and monthly metrics (appointments, qualified leads, new contacts, conversations of value, etc.).

  



**Who You Are / What we expect from you?**

* You have grit. You seek out professional growth. You stay curious. You are trustworthy. You are a team player. You value our customers’ time. You find value in diversity and inclusion.
* You have 1-3 years’ experience with customer service, inbound and outbound tele sales, and market development activities.
* Native in English and Swedish or Danish
* Resilient and confident in overcoming objections and rejections.
* Knowledge of social media tools and social selling.

We offer competitive salaries, bonus plan, health, meal vouchers and many more. Our employees are able to participate in OWN SAP, an award-winning employee share purchase plan, enabling employees to own a part of SAP and build long term value.


We prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion, and part of how we do that is by supporting and promoting employee resource groups. To name a few: Blacks@SAP, GlobalPride@SAP, Women@SAP, Latinos@SAP, Veterans@SAP and many more. You have a passion? We have a resource group for you!

PBM is responsible for the creation and realization of the Nordic software partner business plans. **Work Area:** **Industry Value Advisor**  

**Expected Travel:** 0-60%  

**Career Status:** Professional  

**Employment Type:** Regular Full-time

 **ROLE DESCRIPTION**


Based in our Gothenberg, Stockholm or Copenhagen office, the **Industry Value Advisor** helps our Scandinavian clients transform their organizations to Intelligent Enterprises by collaborating to deliver board-level justifications for large-scale transformation initiatives enabled by SAP solutions. They do this by


* Engaging with client C-level executives on their industry dynamics, strategic objectives and challenges
* Working with SAP solution experts to show how SAP capabilities deliver desired business outcomes
* Using design thinking, diagnostics and process benchmarking to discover value opportunities
* Shaping the value roadmap to calculate and validate the (financial) case-for-change
* Articulating a coherent and compelling case-for-change, tailored to client’s decision makers.

 **JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES & SKILLS**


We are looking for a highly motivated, energetic and curious team player who


* has executive presence and sales awareness to build trust and shape interventions
* is able to manage and execute structured client engagements with a multi-disciplinary team
* is knowledgeable on core and supporting enterprise business processes
* can deal with ambiguity and fill knowledge gaps by networking and actively seeking information
* is analytical, mastering techniques such as facilitation, issue identification and cost-benefit calculation
* uses the pyramid principle to develop clear, structured and high-quality deliverables
* delivers crisp presentations to small and large audiences and deals elegantly with objections.

A minimum of 5-8 years in one or more roles such as

* Strategy, business, and / or technology consulting
* Strategy setting, leading transformation, or P&L responsibility within a blue-chip company - especially in the high-tech, manufacturing, consumer product or retail sectors

* Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) required, MBA or equivalent recommended.
* Fluency in spoken and written English, Skadinavian language a plus

title: Data Scientist - Artificial Intelligence
description:
#### **About the job**


As a Data Scientist in the AI team, you are responsible for designing, deploying, and optimizing AI models and data pipelines. This includes expertise in data manipulation, AI model fine-tuning, and constructing recommendation systems tailored to user needs. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions, build personalized recommendation systems, and integrate cutting-edge AI and NLP techniques into production. Your responsibilities include:


* **Model Development and Optimization:** Develop, fine-tune, and deploy machine learning and NLP models, including custom and pre-trained solutions, using Python and Azure services.
* **Data Pipeline Management:** Build and manage data pipelines, incorporating RAG solutions, data cleaning, tokenization, and transformation processes.
* **Recommendation Systems and Prompt Engineering:** Design recommendation systems and craft effective prompts for models like ChatGPT to ensure accurate, contextually relevant outputs.
* **Performance Evaluation and Innovation:** Develop evaluation frameworks, assess AI model performance, and stay updated on AI advancements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* **Technical Leadership:** Make architectural and technical decisions on model selection, data pipelines, and deployment strategies based on project needs.

#### **Requirements**


We are seeking a curious, collaborative, and growth-oriented professional with experience in agile environments and a strong passion for advancing within the AI field. If you thrive on solving complex challenges and enjoy working at the intersection of technology and innovation, this role offers an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact.


To succeed in this position, you should meet the following requirements:

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Data Science, Computer Science, AI, or a related field, with 3–5 years of experience in data science, data engineering, or AI-related roles.
* Proficiency in Python and machine learning libraries.
* Experience in designing, fine-tuning, and deploying AI solutions
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, including Azure Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI, and Azure Machine Learning.
* Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions and prompt engineering.
* Experience in data cleaning, tokenization, indexing and building scalable data pipelines.
* Proficiency in AI model evaluation methods and prompt engineering for improved model accuracy.
* Experience with the full ML development lifecycle using open-source AI/ML frameworks and public cloud services.

#### **What we Offer**


We strongly believe in working with individuals who love what they do. When you get the opportunity to do what you do best, the result will be exceptional.


We offer you a global development role in an innovative and fast-growing company at the forefront of technology, and we provide you with the opportunity to deliver real value to the customers. We offer competitive benefits, compensation based on competence/performance and highly talented Novacurians as great colleagues. Novacura offers a strong and open corparate culture where each and every employee has the opportunity to influence the development of the company and our processes.

#### **Ready to Join Us?**


If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, we encourage you to apply today. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t miss your chance to be part of something great.


For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Ellen Jingrot, Talent Acquisition, at ellen.jingrot@novacura.com. For inquiries about the role, reach out to Andreas Foung, Development Manager, at andreas.foung@novacura.se.

#### **About Novacura**


At Novacura we are passionate about solutions that enable our customers to work smarter and faster in their businesses. We work with several business systems and our own unique low code platform Novacura Flow. We are a global organization with close cooperation between our offices in different countries and we have high ambitions to continue to develop and grow in all our markets.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
We seek a senior Cloud Architect to help us deliver value to our customers in a consultancy role.

 **Qualifications and skills required**


In-depth knowledge of AWS, Aliyun and Azure services, including compute, storage, networking, database, security, and management tools.  

In-depth knowledge of the automotive domain including telecommunications, telematics and infotainment, both on-board and off-board.  

Strong understanding of cloud architecture principles, including microservices, serverless computing, containers, and hybrid cloud.  

Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages such as Python, PowerShell, or Bash.  

Experience with container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes and containerization  

technologies like Docker.  

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and agile development methodologies.  

Proficiency in message queue technologies such as Kafka and MQTT.  

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in a distributed cloud environment.  

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.  

  

Fluent in English and Chinese languages, both spoken and written.

**Personal attributes**


You are the kind of person that thrives in an environment where everything is not set and gets inspired from defining and implementing solutions. You are pragmatic, self-driven, curious, and flexible.

* Excellent communication skills
* Comfortable with navigating ambiguous and evolving situations
* Proactive, self-starter and ability to manage multiple tasks effectively
* A team-oriented approach and with a flexible mindset

  

-
️Logikfabriken is a consultancy company by and for talented, engaged, and fun people in tech.


Our ambition is to become Sweden's best and most inspiring employer.


Together, we create opportunities and move the company forward.


Spending time together is something we value, which is why we go to two conferences per year, arrange talks, after-work events, and many other fun activities.


In addition to the above, we believe in fair compensation and transparency.  

That’s why everyone at Logikfabriken has the same conditions, set their salary, pension, parental pay, number of vacation days, and other benefits.  

Our model is flexible and secure, and in most cases provides a substantial salary increase.  

Here you can see for yourself what you could earn: Calculate your salary


We are also passionate about sustainability. Since 2017, Logikfabriken has been climate-neutral and constantly works to reduce our footprint.

title: Head of Corporate Lending
description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, **digital yet personal**.


Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.

  

Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!

**About the role**


Northmill Bank is seeking a seasoned Credit Analyst with extensive expertise in real estate financing. The ideal candidate has experience in underwriting large loans secured by real estate, preferably including construction loans, as well as commercial experience managing a portfolio of customers.  

  

This role also includes responsibility for the bank's corporate lending department, targeting a 1 billion SEK portfolio growth in 2025. Initially, you will oversee a team of three senior analysts, with the expectation to build and enhance the department's capabilities to ensure efficient and effective operations.  

You will report directly to Northmill Bank’s Chief Lending & Analytics Officer and offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on the bank's corporate lending strategy.

**Responsibilities**

  

* Underwrite loans secured by real estate, ensuring thorough risk assessment and compliance.
* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Corporate Lending Department, driving performance and efficiency.
* Chair the bank's Credit Underwriting Committee, leading decision-making on loan approvals.
* Develop and enhance operational capabilities to ensure seamless, efficient, and effective processes.

**Qualifications**


We are seeking an experienced Credit Analyst with a proven track record in underwriting real estate loans. The ideal candidate brings extensive banking experience and deep expertise in real estate financing.


* A university degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or Economics.
* At least 10 years of experience in real estate financing.
* Strong knowledge of relevant regulations, including the Capital Requirements Directive
* Proven experience in managing distressed assets and loan workouts.
* 

**Fun Facts:**

* Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
* Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”.
* Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
* Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
* Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
* Stockholm's most beautiful office space that the city has to offer, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.

**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**

title: Logistics Specialist (AWS Data Center)
description:
- Experience as a logistics professional supporting inventory cycle counts, shipments, maintenance and stock control functions
- Able to lift loads of up to 18 kilos and carry them for short distances
- A valid (EU) driving licence is required as data centers may not have any public transportation available nearby.
  

Job summary
Be a part of operating the world’s largest cloud computing infrastructure. Amazon Web Services is seeking a bright, motivated and hard working individual for the Data Center Logistics Specialist position. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines and a commitment to Operational Excellence.
The Logistics Specialist reviews data center inventory, in-bound shipments and ongoing demand to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained in all locations to support build and repair activities. Working with the Logistics Manager, they create plans to optimize the flow of parts through their lifecycle; tracking inventory location, movement, age, and turns. They work closely with Data Center Operations Technicians and Data Center Engineers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately. They work with Procurement and Hardware Engineering to source new parts and interface directly with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements. They are responsible for accurate data entry and resolving questions from peer organizations.
The ideal Logistics Specialist will dive deep into data to understand everything about the data center asset lifecycle. Working with software development teams, they will contribute to continuous process improvements to deliver on our goals of high availability and low cost. They maintain up-to-date metrics dashboards and create reports for internal and external suppliers and management as required.
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion
Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities include manual tasks, such as assembling, addressing, stamping and arranging for the shipment of merchandise and materials. They will also assist in daily scheduling of deliveries and pick-ups to and from production locations. In handling incoming shipments, they unpack boxes and verify contents. The Logistic Specialist will be required to keep precise records of all commodities going in and out of the company.
Logistics Specialists are expected to understand all aspects of the production, adhere to strict safety standards, maintain high levels of quality and be willing to travel to support other locations within and outside the Country.
· Work closely with internal customers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately.
· Coordination of all inbound/outbound deliveries, liaise with vendors, couriers/carriers, transportation and inventory planning teams.
· Receiving/shipping parts logically and physically, ensuring our Inventory management system is up to date and accurate at all times.
· Manage the receipt of all Inventory & non-Inventory items on procurement systems and resolve invoice discrepancies.
· Responsible for accurate data entry and resolving questions from peer organizations.
· Execute stock re-balancing through transfers between locations locally and globally, to ensure stock utilization and availability maximization of parts on each location.
· Responsible for Inventory management, regular cycle counts, customer-oriented storage space optimization, cleanliness, organization and safety of all workspace.
· Ad hoc analysis and projects based on business needs.
· Reverse Logistics; interface directly with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements.
\* Please apply with an English version of your resume
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Relevant Degree in Logistics or Supply Chain
* Experience of working within a complex logistics set-up. Experience in Data Center is a plus
* Project Management experience
* Good knowledge of IT and network equipment
* Ability to identify issues, develop solutions and drive results

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Solution Architect for Tech Sustainability
description:
**Job Description**
 At H&M Group, sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. As part of Tech Sustainability, our mission is to build a platform for real-time sustainability data, helping us achieve ambitious environmental goals and reduce our carbon footprint. We aim to connect sustainability data across our entire value chain—from production to logistics—enabling advanced calculations, predictions, and visualizations through reports and dashboards. Our vision is to fuel a positive impact on our ecosystem by leading the way in sustainability.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect to join our team in our mission to build a world-class sustainability platform for external reporting of ESG legislation. You will be responsible for driving end-to-end architecture solutions for sustainability with close collaboration to the business and other stakeholders within tech. As a solution architect you are responsible for translating business- and tech requirements into architecture blueprints and identifying areas in need of improvements, holistically evaluate the architecture and use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of a technical components, recommending and implementing new solutions. Provide leadership related to the solution development by being responsible for the architecture and delivery of a solution or portfolio of solutions. The Solution Architect needs to ensure alignment with enterprise architecture standards, advancing the architecture towards the target state.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Contextualize business strategy and objectives into capabilities and architectural vision and strategy
* Develop architecture roadmaps and blueprints, creating design artifacts such as Logical Information Models
* Translate business and technical requirements into architecture that guides solution development and supports efficient collaboration with data analysts and data engineers
* Evaluate technologies for strategic fit, contributing to business cases for tech shifts.
* Identify opportunities for improvement, addressing technical debt and enhancing value.
* Provide technical design reviews at various milestones to ensure alignment with architectural principles and organizational goals.
* Embed architecture thinking across the team and support less experienced individuals.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field.
* Experience in architecting/designing solutions built on Cloud (ideally Google or Azure).
* Proficiency in BigQuery, APIs, and other data-driven technologies to support real-time analytics.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specifications, with hands-on experience in programming or software engineering.
* A strong problem-solver who can analyze complex issues, visualize concepts not yet concrete, and develop innovative solutions aligned with H&M’s sustainability goals.
* Demonstrated adaptability and creativity to navigate a fast-paced and evolving environment.
* Ability to provide architecture leadership, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure a smooth handoff from design to implementation, and conducting technical design and quality reviews throughout project milestones.
* Experience evaluating and developing governance structures, methodologies, and compliance measures to ensure security and regulatory alignment (e.g., GDPR) in data handling.
* Commitment to quality and detail-oriented execution, with the drive to identify and address both current and potential obstacles or opportunities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden and requires
 **on-site presence** 
 3-4 days a week.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so send in your application today! Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
*At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Senior Security Engineer
description:
**Senior Security Engineer:** 




  





 For one of our globally leading tech clients we are urgently looking for an experienced Senior Security Engineer for a long contract based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





  





 Its paying well and my client can interview asap!
 



  





  





**Job Description:** 




 The Cloud Security Expert will work with the Public Cloud team to enhance the security posture across AWS, Azure, and GCP. They will ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, implement best practices, and translate compliance needs into actionable security improvements.
 



 Required Skills and Qualifications:

title: Cloud Advisory Manager
description:
**Would you like to shape transformational projects and define cutting edge, cloud-based solutions, solving our clients' most complex issues?**
 As a part of our
 **Cloud Advisory** 
 practice, you will be joining Nordic’s ’s leading technology cloud advisory group. You will assist clients in matching their business and IT goals and find ways to use innovative cloud technology for better business value and cost savings. Your passion and talent will play a key role in advising client management in achieving greater business value from cloud technology.
   

  

 The role is part of the Nordic team consisting of 14 people with diverse backgrounds, united by the passion for cloud technology and business value. We place a strong emphasis on creating a collaborative work environment, diverse community, and maintaining work life balance. With us, you will have the opportunity to work with large scale digital-driven business transformations and serve as trusted advisor for C-level in leading Nordic companies.
   

  

 We at
 **Cloud Advisory** 
 help our clients become industry leaders. With our cross-expertise in cloud technology transformation and management consulting, we work closely with our clients to find their focus areas in the market and identify organizational and cloud technological building blocks to reach the target state. We are helping our clients to create sustainable and digital change for the future to identify value across financial, experience, sustainability, talent, and inclusion & diversity dimensions.
   

  

**Some examples of areas you could work with:**
- Advise clients on how to develop their business by leveraging emerging and established cloud technologies

- Create effective operating models to transform and build organizations ready for growth and stability

- Unlock the value of data, architecture, and AI to drive business agility and transformation to a real-time enterprise

- Identify, quantify, maximize, and sustain value realization from cloud technology investments

- Plan, organize and execute cloud transformation programs

- … and much more!

**How do you know this could be the role for you?**
 We are looking for you who has minimum 8 years relevant experience either from other consultancy companies, large-scale business development, strategy development and implementation in technology driven organizations, or hands on experience with larger-scale cloud transformation. You have a deep business understanding of one or more industries and a proven ability to challenge and transform traditional ways of working by leveraging new cloud technologies, innovative business models and agile ways of working. You excel in leading the development and implementation of strategies that bring transformative ideas and innovations to life.
   

  

 You are fluent in business case generation, value and cost driver identification and operating model creation.
   

  

 As a person, you are analytical with a structural mindset that drives impressive results and thrive in environments where you define, organize, and solve clients' complex challenges. In addition to delivering outcomes, you lead and develop high-performing teams, fostering growth and empowering others to succeed. You inherently know the cloud advantages and what they mean in practice, and also the associated impacts and pitfalls. Fluency in English is mandatory, fluency in local language and experience with frameworks such DevOps, SAFe, Lean portfolio management, TOGAF and ITIL is highly desirable.
   

  

 The position will report to
 **Managing Director** 
**Cloud Advisory, and workplace is the capital city of your home country in the Nordics.**
**Interested?**
**Apply online by attaching your CV, application letter, and educational diplomas as soon as possible.** 
 We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.
 **We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Please reach out to us if you have any questions concerning this position.

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Vi på
 **MSP Nordics** 
 söker ytterligare supporttekniker på heltid för att stötta våra kunder i de lösninar vi distribuerar på den nordiska marknaden.
 



  





 Rollen innebär stora möjligheter att utveckla dina tekniska färdigheter och bygga expertis inom IT-drift, problemlösning och systemhantering. Om du gillar att arbeta med både människor och teknik, är detta en fantastisk chans att växa och utvecklas hos en ung, modern och trygg arbetsgivare som tänker långsiktigt.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 
 I denna spännande roll kommer du att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av uppgifter och spela en central roll i vår dagliga drift.
 



  





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö, stötta medarbetare med tekniska lösningar i pågående säljprojekt, daglig support samt aktivt hjälpa våra kunder med implementeringen av nya produkter och projekt.
 



  





 Du säkerställer att kunderna får bästa möjliga start med våra lösningar och ger dem det stöd som behövs för att framgångsrikt använda våra distribuerade produkter.
 



  





 Du kommer för det mesta att arbeta tillsammans med kollegor på kontoret, men även ute hos kunder och på distans för att säkerställa att deras IT-miljöer är optimerade och att våra lösningar lever upp till deras behov.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Supportera system som PSA, ITSM, RMM, Cybersäkerhetsverktyg, lagring, backup mm.
* Driva och äga implemetationer av våra produkter hos våra kunder för att säkerställa deras framgång.
* Genomföra tekniska projekt från början till slut med fokus på kundnöjdhet och leverans.
* Säkerställa att kunderna har en säker och stabil IT-miljö.
* Vara proaktiv och hålla dig uppdaterad kring de senaste trenderna inom IT-drift och säkerhet.
* Stötta inköp av nya lösningar och bidra med strategiskt framtidstänk inom branschen.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi ser gärna att du har:
 


* Relevant utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT.
* Erfarenhet inom IT, med fokus på teknisk support och systemadministration.
* Erfarenhet av kundsupport/helpdesk inom IT och kunskaper inom ITIL-processflöde (ärendehantering).
* Gedigen kunskap om Microsoft 365 (M365) och SharePoint.
* Förmåga att driva och hantera IT-projekt självständigt.
* Goda kundorienterade färdigheter och social kompetens.
* Som person är du ansvarstagande, driven, lösningsorienterad, samarbetsvillig, nyfiken och har ett öga för detaljer.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* B-körkort.



  





**Varför ska du söka?** 




 Den här rollen erbjuder dig en möjlighet att utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö där teknik och affärsmässighet går hand i hand. Du kommer att ha stor påverkan på kundernas IT-strategier och samtidigt arbeta i ett team som värdesätter innovation och kvalitet. Vi är ett dedikerat team baserat i Stockholm med en arbetsmiljö som är öppen, innovativ och entreprenöriell.
 



  





 Vi eftersträvar att ha en kultur som bygger på egen drivkraft, flexibilitet och samarbetsvilja bland våra medarbetare. Vi har korta beslutsvägar och vårt arbetsklimat präglas av engagemang och hög service. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med marknadens mest attraktiva lösningar.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar löpande urval, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
 



  





**Om Oss** 




 MSP Nordics är den moderna, nytänkande och uppstickande distributörer av IT-lösningar i världsklass. Vår ambition är alltid att vara oberoende och erbjuda marknadens bästa lösningar för att hjälpa våra kunder effektivisera sina verksamheter med smarta affärskritiska system och IT-säkerhet. Med våra produkter kan IT-team automatisera, hantera och åtgärda uppgifter med hjälp av moderna, intuitiva plattformar för att förbättra organisationens effektivitet och lönsamhet. Våra produkter och partners stödjer tusentals IT-avdelningar runt om i världen.

title: Cloud Support Technician
description:
*Zelly är ett ledande ”born-in-the-cloud” företag . Vi utvecklar och optimerar molntjänster från Microsoft och ser till att våra kunder har tillgång till de bäst lämpade molntjänsterna för deras verksamhet.*
**Nu har du chansen att hänga med på vår tillväxtresa!**
 Vi på Zelly växer och behöver nu en till Cloud Support Technician till Customer Care teamet. Vi söker nu dig som är ambitiös med en positiv inställning. Zelly är ett dynamiskt och snabbväxande Cloud-bolag som levererar alla Microsofts plattformar. Vi har en Cloud first-approach och ser styrkan i att nyttja synergier i Microsofts ekosystem. Zelly är den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som vill utvecklas, gillar att ta ansvar och ha möjligheten att påverka din arbetsplats. Vi ser att du är hungrig på ny teknik, vill hjälpa kunder till en bättre, enklare och säkrare vardag.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I supporten har vi daglig kontakt med många av de kunder som använder vår plattform. Kundservice är en central och väsentlig del i vår verksamhet då våra kunders framgång är detsamma som framgång för oss på Zelly. Din främsta uppgift blir att i supporten hantera inkommande ärenden från kunder via ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och mail. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär bland annat felsökning i en Windowsmiljö, konto- och behörighetshantering i Active Directory, Azure AD, Office 365, problemlösning för skrivare, nätverk, dokumentation och en hel del annat. Komplexiteten av ärenden varierar mycket och utvecklingsmöjligheterna är stora.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i Servicedesk med IT-support eller teknisk support
* Kunskap inom exempelvis Windows Server, Active Directory, Azure, Office 365, nätverk & hårdvara
* Strukturerad och organiserad
* förmågan att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska
* Genuin passion för IT och digitalisering
* Van att ha mycket kundkontakt


**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du:**
* Är intresserad av cloud produkter och dess utveckling
* Trivs med frihet under ansvar
* Gillar att utveckla rutiner och processer


**Dina möjligheter hos oss:**
* Bra villkor och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett snabbt expanderande IT-bolag!
* Möjlighet till delägarskap i Aderian Group som är koncernen som Zelly ingår i
* Då vårt mål är att du ska bli bäst på molntjänster betalar vi gärna för din fortbildning. För när du utvecklas – utvecklas vi!
* Självklart erbjuder vi både förmåner och bonusar
* Roliga resor och aktiviteter tillsammans!


 Rekrytering sker löpande – där tillträde och lön sker enligt överenskommelse. Vi kommer genomföra bakgrundskontrol som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs!

title: Global Head of GSI Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We have created a new senior leadership role, Head of Global System Integrator (GSI) Alliances, to lead our business development and partnership with these important actors in the global technology sector. As the publisher of Ubuntu and the leading provider of open source to major technology firms globally, we are expanding into the enterprise market where GSIs provide significant operational and tactical capacity. We have had good success with GSIs that are delivering next-generation private cloud, container, and public cloud solutions built with Canonical Ubuntu, and are looking to expand our investment in these alliances.
   

  

 Reporting to the VP Global Alliances and Channels, the Global Head of GSI Alliances will lead a team of representatives and develop that strategic go-to-market strength for Canonical. You will work closely with GSI partners throughout their sales cycles and across their sales organizations to make Canonical their trusted partner to deliver opensource solutions at scale for their enterprise customers. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring that our solutions are used or embedded at the core of GSI digital transformation platforms.
   

  

 Our GSI team builds trusted relationships with partners at executive level, increases Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelizes the partnership and leads all business interactions from engineers to CxO level. The Global Head of GSI Alliances will own the strategy, sell-to, sell-through and sell-with motions with all GSI partners, as well as promotion of our GSI related activities - from campaigns, to strategic opportunities and GSI related events (including Canonical s yearly GSI executive summit).
   

  

 Our company largely works from home, this role can be based in the Americas or EMEA.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Own and drive GSI partner strategy, forecast, bookings and revenues for Canonical
* Lead and evolve a team towards accelerated revenue growth with GSI
* Build strategic relationships with partners at executive levels
* Guide our offering from product management, to product marketing, and scale it through the support of our global sales organization


 What we are looking for in you:
   

  

 The successful GSI Alliance Sales Director will have :
   

  

* Experience in alliance and indirect sales management roles
* Experience in the GSI sector
* Deep commercial experience encompassing revenue and margins
* Proven leadership and presentation skills
* Insight into open source, Ubuntu and Canonical's competition and opportunities
* Track record of data-driven decision-making
* An autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentality


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Engineering Manager – Shared Cloud Services
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

**We are seeking an Engineering Manager** 
 to lead our Shared Cloud Services Team. In this key role, you will take ownership of guiding an experienced team of developers and cloud engineers, ensuring the delivery of innovative, high-quality software solutions using technologies like Azure, .NET, C#, ASP.NET Core, and more.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment that values continuous learning and personal growth. We welcome applicants of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences. We strive to build a team with high psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable taking risks, learning from failures, and sharing their ideas openly.
   

  

*“Hello, I’m Mikael (He/Him), and I’ve had the privilege of leading this incredible team. As I step into a new role, I’m looking for a manager who believes in creating an environment that prioritizes trust, support, and continuous growth. We value leaders who know that great teams are built on more than technical knowledge—they thrive when members feel empowered to take risks, challenge the status quo, and support each other.”*
**In this role, you will:**
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of highly competent software engineers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and deliver cloud-based solutions using Azure and related technologies.
* Oversee the design, development, and deployment of backend applications in .NET, C#, ASP.NET Core, and Entity Framework Core.
* Ensure high reliability and high quality of internet services through use of Site Reliability Engineering philosophy and processes.
* Drive continuous improvements in development processes, tools, and methodologies.


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Has a solid technical background, preferably in Microsoft technologies and related development stacks.
* Has strong leadership experience and excellent communication skills, ideally managing software development teams, with a proven ability to create a safe, inclusive, and collaborative environment.
* Is committed to growing their team by providing and receiving feedback in a supportive manner.


 We are committed to building a team with a high level of psychological safety, where everyone is encouraged to take risks, learn from failures, and innovate. We also recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Our team enjoys flexible work hours and a range of benefits to support personal well-being and family commitments.
   

  

 Next Step!
   

  

 Please address your questions to maja.tan@ants.se and submit your resume or LinkedIn profile (in English only) through our website. We're looking forward to your application!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Management Consultant - IT Advisory
description:

 We are a management consulting firm focusing on the Financial Services sector. This includes life, health and property & casualty insurance as well as retail and commercial banking.
